posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Melee Demolition Man
As per the title. 

I take the class split devised by Maximillan Kane which has haunting similarities to the Exalted Sorceress (Sorc 38 / Paladin 1 / Monk 1) class split but try to turn the cleric into a melee combatant rather than a zen archer. 

With Monk in the build I go Kama with Monk UBAB (up to 8 APR) to melee them with the backup of Cleric 38 at my disposal.
Before Monk 1 is taken in epic levels I get Exotic Weapon Proficiency to wield a Bastard Sword, Katana or Scythe and equip heavy plate and tower.

Should have enough AB being a cleric with all the boosts (Divine Power, Divine Favor, GMW +5, Bless/Aid, Empowered Bull's) and Base AB 36
AC wise the Monk Wis AC + Dex AC can be buffed with empowered Cat's / Owl's, Magic Vestment, Shield of Faith
Concealment 50% can be obtained with improved invis from Trickery
Extra damage from GMW +5, Darkfire, Empowered Bulls, Divine Favor and 1d6 sneak (eventually)
Base HP is 398, 638 capped. Toughness would have been nice to boost it up further.
Combat feats Blind Fight, Knockdown
Magic feats Silent Spell, Extend Spell, Empower Spell, Craft Wand

Spells / day with Wis capped (36), cantrips to lvl 9 spells:
6 10 9 9 9 9 7 7 7 7
Spells could be:
1. Divine Favor
2. Ext Divine Favor
3. Ext Silence (self targeted)
4. Divine Power / Empowered Stats
5. Ext Divine Power
6. Harm
7. Word of Faith
8. Silent Word of Faith / Extended Aura of Vitality / Empowered Blade Barrier
9. SoV / Summon IX

Plus a few spell buffs like the ones listed above (ie GMW/Darkfire/Bless/Aid/Spell Resistance etc) depending what items you have available to you and your environment

A nice variant would be to drop a few bonus great wisdom feats for Auto-Silent I-III which costs only a few spells / day and some AC and will save. 
Those self targeted silence auras are lethal to spellcasters without auto-silent as explored by Grizzled Dwarflord's Vicar of the Void.

Weaknesses I believe are the fort save is average at 28, Reflex is poor, has evasion. HP could be better. There's no uncanny dodge which would have been nice, which is why I haven't tried to pump dex. Mords and dispels I believe are your enemies, which with 38 CLs you should be somewhat resistant too, although breaches will always strip some buffs away and a dedicated arcane caster will always cause you problems.

posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
A lovely build. I like seeing Clerics that are more than healbots.

As you indicated the likely weaknesses are opponents with dispel on hit, spell breaches or spammed dispels. A Boss that combines buff stripping with knockdown or disarm could be very hard to deal with. Even with 50% concealment, they will eventually get that knockdown. However they may be half dead by then ;-)

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Greetings SnorriHT and thanks for your kind words
I don't think this class combination and amounts has been explored quite as much as I would have liked in a melee form.
This is another variant I like better than the one I posted.

Auto-Silent Melee Demolition Man

I actually like a Str cleric in full plate + tower equipped with a large sword (ie Bastard sword) rather than Kama and Robed
I like Grizzled_Dwarflord's self-silence Auto-Silent I-III strategy, casters hate you and the AI doesn't know what to do with the circle sometimes.
I like the Cleric Bonus Feat (Great Wisdom) cheese to bump up Str and AB a little although that is controversial amongst the ECB I accept that
I find in terms of casting in combat PvM as a str cleric, my go to spells are Divine Favor, Divine Power, Self Targeted Extended Silence, Heal/Harm, Word of Faith
So I rush lvl 7 cleric spells then use the Cleric Bonus Feat cheese to get lvl 8 and 9 spells a little later. (at 24 and 27 respectively)

Going to playtest this one soon

posts.author: SnorriHT
posts.content:
The Classic Cleric; Full Plate, Tower Shield and a plenty of divine favor. Both a caster and a fearsome melee opponent. I like it!

I am wedded to the idea that melee build = discipline. However the flexibility to either melee or cast at range makes Discipline a moot point. The character can choose the type of engagement. Similarly Tumble provides effective disengagement if hit points are low and a heal is not available.

My only suggestion, is it worth moving Weapon Focus: Bastard Sword to level 6 to get more use out of it?

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
The monk level in your second build seems like a waste of a class to me. Since you're wearing armor you miss out on most monk benefits, it isn't used as a Discipline dump, and you don't take it in pre-epic levels to boost your saves. Currently the only thing it adds in comparison to a Cler38/Rog2 is early Evasion instead of early UMD. Maybe the increased playabilty is worth it but I personally dislike adding levels that are wasted at 40.

Although it goes against the entire concept of this build, which is a melee Cler38/Monk1/Rog1, I would recommend a Cler36/Figh2/Rog2 or something similar for a high caster level battle cleric that wears armor.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Greetings SnorriHT and Yunim!
Thanks for your comments and kind words.

I did think of taking the WF: Bastard Sword earlier for + 1 AB, however clerics have lots of AB buffs so I pushed the feat late.
There is a situation where you may wish to take the weapon focus earlier, that is in an environment with Weapon Focus Chests.
To explain, these are specially scripted chests (or weapon racks, or whatever container the designer creates) which create an appropriately enchanted weapon, if you have a weapon focus in a particular weapon.
The earlier you take this feat, the more magical bastard swords you get to pick up as loot!

With Monk 1 Yunim, I actually wasn't completely wedded to the C38/M1/Ro1 concept, I did think of C38/Ro2 as you thought as well, the earlier rogue level is nice for the skill dumps too!
That being said I chose to keep  Monk 1 as it provides Cleave at level 22, if I wanted cleave in the build I would have to take two feats, earlier evasion also enhances playability throughout leveling in PvM as you mentioned.
I chose not to drop caster levels for Mord resistance but dropping cleric down for something else can be done if desired
There is something special about ultra high level casters however, like in builds such as Demolition Man and Exalted Sorceress
